subject: Parenting
title: Sensation Seeking vs Impulsivity
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sensation Seeking vs Impulsivity usable.

hook.text: Jumping off a cliff into water is sensation seeking. Texting while driving is impulsivity. They're different.

buildup.text: Sensation seeking peaks around 15 and is about craving intense experiences.

discovery.text: Impulsivity is about poor self-control â€” and it actually declines steadily through adolescence.

twist.text: The dangerous window is early adolescence, when sensation seeking is high and impulse control is low.

climax.text: By late teens, rising self-control begins to balance the still-strong thrill drive.

punchline.text: The urge stays. The control catches up.

quiz.question: When is the most dangerous window for teen risk behavior?
options: Early adolescence when sensation seeking is high and control is low
